column4: morning: I have broken packages apt-get clean && sudo apt-get check don't fix
can you please pastebin the output of: sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get -f install; sudo apt-get upgrade
http://pastebin.com/m64f8963a
ok looks like you will need to create some files
all the files it says are missing, use those filenames with touch
It's not overriding the local build ( I didn't know this package exist) I think it's symlinking glue
e.g. touch /usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/mapnik/__init__.py
once you recreate those files you should then be able to remove it
Done the touch, no output
you won't
now do the other file names in your output
ok 1 minute
in linux you dont get a nice "ok" as its a waste of time
no news is good news
I've done that for all
Redo sudo apt-get -f install; sudo apt-get upgrade ?
after creating those files, yes
Same output, same issue: dpkg: error processing python-mapnik (--configure):
same error about the files?
Yes, exactly the same output
sounds like a bug.

while trying to compile the package from subversion svn, the python test run fails because of some bad symlinking, the mapnik.org wiki says it may be Boost version is not compatible with the Mapnik release version, in such case, the how-to fix link is empty.
